pr_title: [fronius] Add support for Fronius Smart Meter

timeline.message:
[fronius] Add support for Fronius Smart Meter

Signed-off-by: Jimmy Tanagra <jcode@tanagra.id.au>

timeline.bodyText: You could move this into a package called dto or append DTO to the class name to get rid of the checkstyle warning about missing NonNullByDefault annotation.
timeline.author: fwolter
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,34 @@

+package org.openhab.binding.fronius.internal.api;
+
+import com.google.gson.annotations.SerializedName;
+
+/**
+ * The {@link MeterRealtimeBody} is responsible for storing
+ * the "body" node of the JSON response
+ *
+ * @author Jimmy Tanagra - Initial contribution
+ */
+public class MeterRealtimeBody {

timeline.message: Merge branch 'main' of https://github.com/openhab/openhab-addons into fronius-smart-meter

[fronius] Use DTO, implement UoM

Signed-off-by: Jimmy Tanagra <jcode@tanagra.id.au>

[fronius] Add mandatory label for channel-type and fix property update

Signed-off-by: Jimmy Tanagra <jcode@tanagra.id.au>

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't you fill out the errorMsg here?
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: This was original code, just moved to this class. Nevertheless, good catch. I have assigned e.getMessage() to errorMsg.
replies.author: jimtng

timeline.bodyText: Please cache meterRealtimeResponse.getBody().getData() to a local variable and use it instead of calling it a million times.
timeline.author: cpmeister
cpmeister

timeline.message:
[fronius] Store meterRealtimeBodyData instead of meterRealtimeResponse

Signed-off-by: Jimmy Tanagra <jcode@tanagra.id.au>
